data.title: Which ruler made Bidar the capital of the Bahmani Sultanate and invited artisans from Turkey and Persia to enhance the region's art and architecture?
data.meta_description: Ahmed Shah Wali Bahmani Ahmed Shah Wali Bahmani made Bidar the capital of the Bahmani Sultanate and invited artisans from Turkey and Persia to enhance the regions art and architecture
data.text:
Q. Which ruler made Bidar the capital of the Bahmani Sultanate and invited artisans from Turkey and Persia to enhance the region's art and architecture?

Answer: Ahmed Shah Wali Bahmani

Notes: Ahmed Shah Wali Bahmani made Bidar the capital of the Bahmani Sultanate and invited artisans from Turkey and Persia to enhance the region's art and architecture.

0

The above question is part of Karnataka General Studies MCQ Series Course on GKToday Android app.
